column1: '''''nóre''''' (or ''nōre'') is a [[Quenya]] word used for "'land' associated with a particular people".<ref name=WJ>{{WJ
Originally it meant "people", but it was blended and confused with the quite distinct root ''ndor'' "dry land" (cf. [[Sindarin]] ''[[dôr]]'')<ref name=elem>{{S
column2: Elements}}</ref> and the suffix forms ''-nórë'', ''-ndórë'' or ''-dórë'' are also seen shortened to ''-or''.

column1: In the early manuscript the [[The Etymologies
column2: ''Etymologies'']], Quenya ''nóre'' is glossed as "country, land, race".<ref>{{LR

column1: *[[Númenor]] = ''Númen(n)órë'' ("people of the West") and ''Númendor'' ("land of the West")<ref name=elem/>
*[[Valinor]] = ''Valinórë'' (strictly "the people of the Valar") and ''Valandor'' ("the land of the Valar")<ref name=elem/>
*On the other hand, ''Endórë, [[Endor]]'' = ENED + NDOR<ref name=elem/>
